message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a new method for recommendation that models the temporal dynamics of user preferences over items using an attention-gated recurrent network. This involves learning the attention scores of user and item history in an interacting way to account for the dependencies between user and item dynamics in shaping user-item interactions. This work is therefore likely to be relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computational linguistics (cs.CL), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
